result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Williams Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

May be done all under Huber
1 day jail credit 
Jail sentence to be transferred to Waukesha County or Milwaukee County 
60 days to start jail term
Report to jail today

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Williams Meyer

defendant.name: Meyer, Jason Williams
defendant.address: 10431 W Pine Ridge Rd, Greenfield, WI 53228

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: letter re:  cash bond and addressing disposition

Defendant Jason Williams Meyer in court with attorney William R. F. Ackell. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-273 and 15TR-1904 through 15TR-1909.

12:04 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

State has filed an amended information.

Atty Ackell received a copy of the amended information.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

There is a plea agreement.
Atty Cousins states plea agreeement.
Defendant will plead Count 1.

Defendant will also plead to the TR cases. (15TR-1904 through 15TR-1909)

Atty Ackell concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 15CF-273.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Ackell for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Failure to Obey Traffic Officer/Signal

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Ackell makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court finds recommendation is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 40 Days
May be done all under Huber
1 Day Jail Credit
Jail sentence may be transferred to Waukesha County or Milwaukee County
60 days to start term
Report to jail today 
Pay a fine of $1,000 plus costs
Cash bond of $2,500 posted may be applied to fine and costs

State will file a stipulation with regards to the TR cases

Defendant Jason Williams Meyer in court with attorney William R. F. Ackell. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:38 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, spoke with Defense, needs additional time to go over plea agreement.

Matter will be adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jason Williams Meyer in court with attorney William R. F. Ackell. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jason Williams Meyer in court with attorney William R. F. Ackell. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.
15TR1904 thru 15TR1909 to follow as status.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Vehicle Flee/Elude Officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $5,000 cash bond.
Court questions the defendant.   
Defendant lives and works in Greenfield. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7/27/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
